717707f-a.text:
Broadway, north from but not including West 114th Street, showing workmen working on sewer and water main chhanges.incident to the proposed construction of the Interborough Rapid Transit Co. subway. It was found necessary, in view of the proposed subway, to make drastic changes in the layout of mains. (See New York Times, December 2, 1900, Page 14, column 1). In the right background is shown Havemever Hall, a unit of Columbia University between West 116th and West 120th Streets, and left;
Barnard College, at the N.W. corner of West 119th Street.
October 30, 1900.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
Williams B. Parsons Collection.

717708f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, north from West 114th Street, showing on the west side (left),three apartment houses the Luxor, Regnor and Rexor that face units of Columbia University (right). The latter in the order of their appearance are: Furnald Hall, the School of Journalism, the School for
Business and the School of Mines.
September 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A view solely of the University Building and grounds. Note the gabled house, at the N.E. corner of Broadway and West 114th Street.
September 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A detail of No. 2, showing the aforementioned cottage. .ON.the extreme right appears a portion of South Hall and Library.
September 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

717709f-a.text:
Broadway, north from West 114th Street, and showing on the east side of this thoroughfare, units of Columbia University. In the right background appears the tower atop the Administration Building of the Union Theological Seminary, another unit of this educational enterprise.
September 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

About 1911.
